intro: Hieracium glaucosarcoides, commonly known as the glaucous hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternating leaf arrangements. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped, hairy, and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. It is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
